entry.title: French Workers Mount New Strike Against Macron's Pension Overhaul
entry.content: Striking teachers and railway, health and oil workers staged marches in dozens of cities as a part of a nationwide day of action called by unions to force the government to back down.

entry.title: Ukraine Fends Off Russian Assaults in the East
entry.content: Kyiv said its forces had repelled multiple Russian attacks around Bakhmut, as Moscowâ€™s troops pushed to encircle the besieged city.

entry.title: Iran's Deadly Street Protests Are Replaced by Quiet Acts of Rebellion
entry.content: Arrests and executions have smothered organized demonstrations, yet thousands of women in Tehran have abandoned compulsory headscarves in protest.

entry.title: In Besieged Bakhmut, Everyday Life Is a Struggle to Survive
entry.content: A city of some 80,000 before the war, the eastern Ukrainian city is now home to barely a few thousand who endure hardship every day, as Russian forces press forward house by house and bombard it with artillery.
